meanings.definition: A round vegetable with large green or purple leaves that can be eaten cooked or raw.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy eating cabbage in my salad.
meanings.sent2: She bought some fresh cabbage from the market.
meanings.sent3: The cabbage rolled off the table and onto the floor!
meanings.sent4: The field of cabbage stretched out like a sea of green waves.
meanings.sent5: The smell of cooking cabbage filled the kitchen with a comforting aroma.

meanings.definition: To steal or appropriate without permission.
meanings.sent1: He tried to cabbage some cookies from the jar when no one was looking.
meanings.sent2: The thief was caught trying to cabbage money from the cash register.
meanings.sent3: She always tries to cabbage extra office supplies for her desk.
meanings.sent4: The pickpocket managed to cabbage the wallet without anyone noticing.
meanings.sent5: The sneaky raccoon attempted to cabbage food from the campsite.
